title: Oscar Barrientos
text:
Oscar Barrientos (born July 16, 1943 Occidental Mindoro, Philippines) is a retired <a href="Judiciary%20of%20the%20Philippines">Philippine</a> <a href="Regional%20Trial%20Court">Regional Trial Court</a> <a href="judge">judge</a>. He has been an <a href="executive%20vice%20president">executive vice president</a> of and spokesman for <a href="Mighty%20Corporation">Mighty Corporation</a> since November 2013.
Career.
Barrientos is a qualified <a href="lawyer">lawyer</a> and a <a href="certified%20public%20accountant">certified public accountant</a>; he was admitted to the Philippine Bar on March 9, 1971. He graduated from <a href="Far%20Eastern%20University">Far Eastern University</a> in Manila with a <a href="double%20major">double major</a> in commerce and <a href="law">law</a>. He later earned a <a href="master%27s%20degree">master's degree</a> at the <a href="Asian%20Institute%20of%20Management">Asian Institute of Management</a>.
Barrientos is a businessman, <a href="professor">professor</a>, and lawyer, with experience in <a href="corporate%20law">corporate law</a>, <a href="financial%20management">financial management</a>, and <a href="managerial%20accounting">managerial accounting</a>. He was appointed judge of Malolos <a href="Regional%20Trial%20Court">Regional Trial Court</a> (Branch 82) in 1995. Barrientos retired from the bench and took a leave from teaching in late 2012.
